metadata.Title: CVE-2021-27928 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A remote code execution issue was discovered in MariaDB 10.2 before 10.2.37, 10.3 before 10.3.28, 10.4 before 10.4.18, and 10.5 before 10.5.9; Percona Server through 2021-03-03; and the wsrep patch through 2021-03-03 for MySQL. An untrusted search path leads to eval injection, in which a database SUPER user can execute OS commands after modifying wsrep_provider and wsrep_notify_cmd. NOTE: this does not affect an Oracle product.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-27928` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmariadb3 - 1:10.5.9-1
libmariadbd19 - 1:10.5.9-1
mariadb-backup - 1:10.5.9-1
mariadb-client - 1:10.5.9-1
mariadb-client-10.5 - 1:10.5.9-1
mariadb-client-core-10.5 - 1:10.5.9-1
mariadb-common - 1:10.5.9-1
mariadb-plugin-connect - 1:10.5.9-1
mariadb-plugin-cracklib-password-check - 1:10.5.9-1
mariadb-plugin-gssapi-client - 1:10.5.9-1
mariadb-plugin-gssapi-server - 1:10.5.9-1
mariadb-plugin-mroonga - 1:10.5.9-1
mariadb-plugin-oqgraph - 1:10.5.9-1
mariadb-plugin-rocksdb - 1:10.5.9-1
mariadb-plugin-s3 - 1:10.5.9-1
mariadb-plugin-spider - 1:10.5.9-1
mariadb-server - 1:10.5.9-1
mariadb-server-10.5 - 1:10.5.9-1
mariadb-server-core-10.5 - 1:10.5.9-1
mariadb-test - 1:10.5.9-1
mariadb-test-data - 1:10.5.9-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mariadb-10.5 package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:10.5.9-1').
